lines: While you are turning the pages of a newspaper one morning, you notice that your fingers feel stiff. There are sharp pains shooting up the backs of your fingers and hands.

The doctor tells you that the stiffness in your joints is arthritis. It will affect you most when the weather is damp, or when you have just awakened in the morning. There is nothing that can cure it, but sometimes aspirin helps. This
kind of ache is something that you will have to tolerate almost every day now.

You are beginning to feel the first symptoms of arthritis, as you might have suspected. Aspirin works just about as well as anything else, but it is always a good idea to get frequent physical checkups at your age.

I guess you are resigned to the fact that with advancing age comes a wide variety of aches and pains. If you guessed that you are experiencing a touch of arthritis, you are correct. Aspirin works just about as well as anything else.
